t: To the choirmaster: according to Do Not Destroy. A Miktam of David.
Do*pn you indeed decree what is right, you gods? Do*ld you judge the children of man uprightly?
No,*ln in your hearts you devise wrongs; your*ld hands deal out violence on earth.
The*pn wicked are estranged from the womb; they*ld go astray from birth, speaking lies.
They*ln have venom like the venom of a serpent, like*ld the deaf adder that stops its ear,
so*ln that it does not hear the voice of charmers or*ld of the cunning enchanter.
O*pn God, break the teeth in their mouths; tear*ld out the fangs of the young lions, O Lord!*s
Let*ln them vanish like water that runs away; when*ld he aims his arrows, let them be blunted.
Let*ln them be like the snail that dissolves into slime, like*ld the stillborn child who never sees the sun.
Sooner*ln than your pots can feel the heat of thorns, whether*ld green or ablaze, may he sweep them away!
The*pn righteous will rejoice when he sees the vengeance; he*ld will bathe his feet in the blood of the wicked.
Mankind*ln will say, “Surely there is a reward for the righteous; surely*ld there is a God who judges on earth.”
